subject: Sales
title: The Subscription Economy
description: A 60-second lesson on The Subscription Economy.

hook.text: You don't own music anymore. You subscribe. You don't buy software. You rent it month by month.

buildup.text: Subscriptions replaced ownership as the default. Recurring revenue reshaped every industry.

discovery.text: Keeping a customer proved cheaper than finding new ones. Retention became the ultimate growth metric.

twist.text: Subscription fatigue is now real. The average consumer juggles twelve or more recurring charges.

climax.text: The subscription model proved selling once is never enough. The best businesses sell continuously.

punchline.text: One sale is good. Recurring revenue is better.

quiz.question: What is subscription fatigue?
options: Consumers overwhelmed by too many recurring charges
